name: Nicosia
fun_fact: Fun fact: Nicosia is the world's last divided capital city, split between Greek and Turkish Cyprus - and on the Greek side, you can still buy traditional halloumi through a rotating wooden shelf from cloistered nuns who have made it for centuries!

hero_dishes.name: Meze
hero_dishes.description: 20-30 small dishes served over hours - olives, tahini, hummus, grilled halloumi, sheftalia sausages, kleftiko lamb
hero_dishes.origin_story: Ultimate expression of Cypriot hospitality, designed for hours of sharing
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Zanettos (since 1938), traditional tavernas in old town

hero_dishes.name: Halloumi
hero_dishes.description: Semi-hard cheese from goat and sheep milk, grilled until squeaky
hero_dishes.origin_story: National cheese of Cyprus, Protected Designation of Origin product
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Every restaurant, famously served with watermelon in summer

hero_dishes.name: Kleftiko
hero_dishes.description: Slow-cooked lamb baked in sealed clay oven until fall-apart tender
hero_dishes.origin_story: Traditionally cooked in underground ovens by shepherds

hero_dishes.name: Sheftalia
hero_dishes.description: Grilled pork sausages wrapped in caul fat
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Every meze spread, street food stalls

signature_drinks.name: Brandy Sour
signature_drinks.description: Cyprus's national cocktail - brandy, lemon squash, Angostura bitters, soda

signature_drinks.name: Cypriot Coffee
signature_drinks.description: Finely ground coffee brewed in copper briki with kaimaki foam
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Slowly sipped, reading fortunes in the grounds

food_culture_notes: Meze meals can last 3-4 hours with endless courses
Zanettos has been serving authentic meze since 1938
Spoon sweets (preserved fruits) served with cold water
Loukoumades (mini doughnuts with honey) are beloved street dessert
